H0.text: Mars is the celestial body that the Earth moves once around each year.

H1.text: The Sun is the object around which the Earth moves once each year.

H2.text: The Moon is the body around which the Earth moves once each year.

H3.text: All the other planets are the celestial bodies that the Earth moves around once each year.

A4.text: Earth orbits the Sun at an average distance of 149.60 million km (92.96 million mi), or 8.317 light-minutes, in a counterclockwise direction as viewed from above the Northern Hemisphere.

A5.text: Heliocentrism is the scientific model that first placed the Sun at the center of the Solar System and put the planets, including Earth, in its orbit.
